name: Vegan Mole Chilaquiles with Greens and Beans
description: Vegan mole chilaquiles are tortilla chips covered in mole sauce and mixed with sautéed greens and black beans, then drizzled with an almond crema, and vegan queso cotija. The combination is seriously good.

video.name: Mole Chilaquiles
video.description: Mole Chilaquiles with braised greens and black beans.

recipeIngredient: 24  corn tortillas, (cut into triangles (12ths) or (1 bag of corn chips))
1  White onion, (cut into very thin rings)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F. Place tortilla triangle on two baking sheets lined with parchment and bake for 15 to 20 minutes until crispy. Remove from oven and set aside. (You can also fry them in a heavy bottomed sauté pan until golden brown, or buy a bag of chips.)
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 400°F. Place tortilla triangle on two baking sheets lined with parchment and bake for 15 to 20 minutes until crispy. Remove from oven and set aside. (You can also fry them in a heavy bottomed sauté pan until golden brown, or buy a bag of chips.)

itemListElement.text: Heat a large sauté pan to medium heat and pour in ¼ cup of water. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add spinach and mix.
itemListElement.name: Heat a large sauté pan to medium heat and pour in ¼ cup of water. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add spinach and mix.

itemListElement.text: Once spinach has cooked down (about 2 minutes) add black beans. Season with salt and pepper.
itemListElement.name: Once spinach has cooked down (about 2 minutes) add black beans. Season with salt and pepper.

itemListElement.text: Set a large pot to medium heat, add 1 cup of vegetable stock and mole paste. Stir.
itemListElement.name: Set a large pot to medium heat, add 1 cup of vegetable stock and mole paste. Stir.

itemListElement.text: Once the mole paste dissolves, and the mixture starts simmering, add the second cup of vegetable stock. It will seem like the mole is too thin, but as soon as the mole cools down even a little bit it thickens. Bring to a simmer, stir, and remove from heat.
itemListElement.name: Once the mole paste dissolves, and the mixture starts simmering, add the second cup of vegetable stock. It will seem like the mole is too thin, but as soon as the mole cools down even a little bit it thickens. Bring to a simmer, stir, and remove from heat.

itemListElement.text: Make sure your mole is the right consistency, it should be the consistency of a thin cream soup, adjust as necessary with vegetable stock.
itemListElement.name: Make sure your mole is the right consistency, it should be the consistency of a thin cream soup, adjust as necessary with vegetable stock.

itemListElement.text: Add chips, and the greens and beans into the pot with the mole. Mix well to coat. Serve immediately and top with almond crema, vegan queso Cotija, and onion.
itemListElement.name: Add chips, and the greens and beans into the pot with the mole. Mix well to coat. Serve immediately and top with almond crema, vegan queso Cotija, and onion.
